comment: Keine Ahnung was gemacht wird, aber das Plugin ist schlimm. Restore/Discard geht nicht, der Copilot zerschisst regelmässig die Files, er vergisst schon nach einer Zeile den Context. Es sieht zwar ähnlich aus, wie der Copilot von VSCode, es ist aber so vollkommen unbrauchbar.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I use GitHub Copilot more than any other, because of the low cost.

It is an absolutely horrid bit of software. Normally it swallows the first prompt you send after it initializes, so if you forget that, and write the prompt in the text entry box without copying it from somwehere else you can lose a ton of effort and time. And it will re-initialize after some time of not being used even if the IDE itself has remained open, so it can seem quite random when it swallows prompts.

It frequently hangs, saying that it is working, but seems to be stuck, on prompts that are not complicated enough to warrant a very long lapse.

It frequently loses track of itself. The output stream of token responses will continue flowing even though the "play" / "stop" button has become disconnected from it, meaning that there is no way to stop the process, except to send a new process, or to close the IDE and start over.

It doesn't know how to use its own tools very well. It will frequently cat files in the project instead of using it's own read_file tool.

This is compounded by the fact that the AI Chat windows quickly loses the ability to see terminal output, but even though I explain this, and tell it to redirect output to file and read it with read_file, it will never remember this instruction for long, even when I attach it in COPILOT_INSTRUCTIONS.md.

It has no understanding of lint rules, and is generally terrible at following existing patterns in a codebase. If the goal is to understand the whole codebase it fails completely.

Everytime it needs to open a new terminal, which is at least once per session, the first command is swallowed by the terminal (running Bazzite, and direnv, which both have shell init stuff that runs. Copiloyt is unable to comprehend, or remember, this limitation, and frequently gets lost trying to figure this out.

It is VERY poorly integrated with the IDE.

Everytime it changes a file the file is opened, made active, and the cursor hijacks typing into the file that Copilot is editing. This freqeuntly results in human typing being interleaved with AI edits, or otherwise mangling, deleting, moving, AI edits, depending on what keys I am hitting as it is hijacking the focus.

This is bar none the worst user experience of any tool I have ever used.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I like it, but the thing I dislike the most is the text editor they're using.

That's my biggest pain point atm.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Works as expected. For JVM projects this is perfect, you get the versatility of IntelliJ and the integration of a smart ai with automatic context collection. I'm not really sure why this plugin has so many 1 star reviews, perhaps previous versions? i've been using it for 1 month now daily (end of 2025) and its perfect.

Lots of unnecessary spam in the output, with delays while various "tools" are run. It's making my head hurt. It also immediately crashed on upgrade.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Idea is nice, but it's not reliable at all for me.

Agent: Absolutely daft. All of its tools time out (digging though the library folder in a Unity project often), and thus the agent struggles to do anything useful. Autocomplete: Fast, but decidedly worse than Augment Code. Context: Very limited, there's no broad indexing, it can only fetch files. MCP: Limited, it struggles to connect to many MCP servers I would use, such as Rider's built-in MCP, that would allow me to equip the agent with tools that actually work. :\

The quick chat features are where Copilot seems to shine, but that's where every AI tool shines...

comment: This AI is a pleasure to work with, although its the same as any other AI. Annoying, not listening, hardheaded and sometimes simply doing what it wants to do without any assignment from me or any confirmation from my side. For example, it happens many times that he asked me to confirm something that he's about to do but doesn't wait for my answer, just replies "ok, lets do it". Once, i asked him to find hard coded text in the code and move it to strings. Quite simple, don't you think? When i was looking how he's changing things, he suddenly starts to change things that has nothing to do with hard coded text or string.xml.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Using it for IntelliJ. Very buggy.

  • Very often the agent doesn't see the terminal output, which is annoying when you work in gradle projects
  • You can't select the text in the chat window... WHY?
  • There is no way to edit your previous message
  • Sometimes it randomly opens a new chat, asking you if you want to keep the current changes
  • Sometimes your messages disappear. Specially annoying when you restart the IDE because of a bug and then your last message is gone, while the agent already changes code. It won't remember it's changes.

comment: This feels like it's intentionally left a buggy mess to promote competing editors. Every other update breaks.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Overall it can be a very useful plugin and it has to much potential, obviously. However it's very buggy! It often completely drops the new query I just wrote, opens the same old file that I used only once long time ago and shows me the previous AI conversation. If you wrote a long prompt and didn't save it, you're out of luck.

Another thing is that weirdly hardcoded file. I worked on one Helm file months ago and until today the plugin just opens it any time I pull up the Copilot plugin and start a new session.

Finally it never cleans up the tons of scripts and .md files it creates nor does it give an easy one-click solution to delete the files it created. I find myself having to chase these files in different folders of the project and deleting them manually.

The code line counting very often doesn't work, it gets the lines wrong and tells me "as you can see in line 400" where line 400 will be a completely unrelated piece of code.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: At the moment, only github-copilot-intellij-1.5.58-243 works with the latest DataGrip. You can download the plugin file from here. They likely don't plan to fix this, since they want users to switch to their own AI assistant.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
You know, Qoder is my brother. We’ve fought side by side and defeated countless opponents. I’ve been using agent mode since the early days—this guy is unbelievably powerful.

I truly believe that when the two of us team up, we’ll create something special—real chemistry.

Sometimes, making a decision is hard. After many sleepless nights of thinking it through, I’ve made up my mind: I’m going to take my talents to Qoder.

I can’t wait to activate Qoder’s premium plan.

As for GitHub Copilot— I wish it all the best in JetBrains.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Long list of issues:

  • giant security/ permission bug, plugin will run commands on the active window regardless of the project it was started in, which also means that you cannot have multiple chat sessions or multiple windows open when using the plugin.
  • Starting a new session takes over a minute to reset the chat session
  • Fails to run any agent mode/ chat (20% of the time) and clears everything you typed and resets the IDE tab to blank
  • Accept changes button does wrong Z index on macOS, causing it to be shown over all active windows, and other times loses track of where the IDE window will be on its own screen.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I've used the GitHub CoPilot Pro+ plan through VS Code using Claude Sonnet 4.5 or Opus - The results are pretty amazing to be honest

I've now used GitHub CoPilot with Jetbrain's Plugin on a similar plan but at a enterprise level - And it's like babysitting a child who's coding for the first time

After some digging around it turns out... the performance you get is very specific to the IDE you're using. They all integrate with the LLMs differently so you'll get very different results.

GitHub Copilot is heavily optimized for VS Code. It's takes all files into consideration, has context, full conversation history, etc... and has amazing results.

This Jetbrains extension is still in it's infancy. It could be as great as VS Code, but it's definitely not there yet.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: As they have a competing product, you kind of wonder if this is broke for a reason. I love the IDE but hate that this continues to occur.
